page_analysis.text_content:
Recessed porches on the 1st floor

Recessed porches on the ground floor do NOT count toward
gross floor area if ALL the following criteria apply:

• Depth of porch is less than 10' and,
• Porch ceiling is below 2nd floor and,
• Exterior side is substantially open.

Note: It is the city's policy to consider
one-story construction to be construction
less than 17' above finished floor. If the
porch space is higher, the area will count
again as 2nd story equivalency.

Fig 9 Recessed porches on the 1st floor

2nd floor line
Porch ceiling
below 2nd floor

A This example complies with all three
critera and does NOT count toward
gross floor area

Depth < 10'

2nd floor line
Height extends past
2nd floor line

B This example violates two of the three critera:
• the porch depth is greater than 10' and
• the porch ceiling is above the 2nd floor
Therefore it DOES count toward gross floos area and
if it is higher than 17' it will count twice (see note).

Depth ≥ 10'

14

visual_elements.description: Figure 9 consists of two axonometric diagrams, labeled A and B, illustrating rules for recessed porches on the 1st floor. Both diagrams show a two-story building with a recessed porch at the ground level, with the porch area outlined by a thick dashed line.
visual_elements.location: Middle to bottom of the page

visual_elements.description: Diagram A shows a building where the recessed porch complies with the regulations. Callouts indicate the 'Porch ceiling below 2nd floor' and a 'Depth < 10''. A horizontal line indicates the '2nd floor line'. The text below states this example does NOT count toward gross floor area.
visual_elements.location: Left side of the figure area

visual_elements.description: Diagram B shows a building where the recessed porch violates the regulations. Callouts indicate the 'Height extends past 2nd floor line' and a 'Depth ≥ 10''. A horizontal line indicates the '2nd floor line'. The text below states this example DOES count toward gross floor area because the depth is greater than 10' and the ceiling is above the 2nd floor.
visual_elements.location: Right side of the figure area

visual_elements.description: A grey rectangular box in the upper right quadrant contains a 'Note' about city policy regarding one-story construction height and 2nd story equivalency.

subheadings: Recessed porches on the ground floor do NOT count toward gross floor area if ALL the following criteria apply:
Fig 9 Recessed porches on the 1st floor

additional_notes: Page number '14' is present in the bottom left corner.
The document appears to be a clean digital file or high-quality scan with no handwritten annotations or stamps.
In the description for example B, 'critera' is likely a typo for 'criteria'.
In the description for example B, 'floos' is likely a typo for 'floor'.
cross_references: The description for example B contains the phrase '(see note)', which refers to the 'Note' box located in the upper right of the same page.
